                        Yogapradīpa
                    23 tiff images representing 23 folios

                    Digital copy at the British Library

content.value:
Transcription of MS EAP729/1/2/660 in the Chinmaya International Foundation's
                    collection

This eText is transcribed from digital scans of an Original manuscript written
                    in Devanāgarī script.

A transcription from a scan of MS Chinmaya International Foundation (CIF)
                    EAP729/1/2/660.

A text on the Yoga philosophy. A Jain text
                    because it mentions śukladhyāna, the three jewels (jñānadarśanacaritra),
                    aṣṭakarma and pārśvaprabhu (= pārśvanātha). It teaches a system of aṣṭāṅgayoga
                    (saṃyama, niyama, karaṇa, prāṇāyāma, pratyahārā samādhir dhāraṇā and dhyāna.
                    Dhyāna seems higher than samādhi. However, there are references to the no-mind
                    state and laya (absorption) in Brahma.

The text may be any of the several works of this title mentioned in NCC 22,
                    pp. 80-81. It is not
Śubhacandra
's
Jñānārṇava
The International Alphabet of Sanskrit Transliteration

). IAST differs
                    in small ways from ISO 15919, but is preferred by most working Sanskrit
                    scholars. Conversion of this file to ISO 15919 can be achieved by performing the
                    following replacements throughout the file:
ṛ -> r̥ and ṃ -> ṁ
Text division is etymological ("ity evam" not "ityevam".)
Notes and queries by the CIF transcriber are marked as
note
s.

Verse passages are grouped
                        within the line-group tag,
lg

, and individually tagged as verse
                        lines,
l

children.text: yāvan na grasyate rogair yāvan nābhyeti te jarā |
yāvan na kṣīyate vāyus tāvat kalyāṇam ācara
ko bandhur mama kasyāham ity ātmānaṃ vicintayet
puruṣās tīrtham icchanti kiṃ tirthaiḥ kleśakāraṇaiḥ |
idaṃ tīrtham idaṃ tīrtham iti jñātvā bhramante ye |
jñānadhyānavihīnās te sati tīrthaṃ svam eva hi
kenāpi dṛśyate naiva svātmāyaṃ paśyato haraḥ
lokair vilokyate cauro gate svalpe 'pi vastuni |
sarvasvaharam ātmānaṃ manāk paśyanti no jaḍāḥ
aprasannaḥ punar ayaṃ durgatiḥ syād asaṃśayam
ṣaṭcakravat tu pīṭhādi sarvaṃ tyaktā mumukṣubhiḥ | [tyaktvā?]
ātmajñānaṃ paraṃ tīrthaṃ na jalaṃ tīrtham ucyate |
svātmajñānena yac chaucaṃ tac chaucaṃ paramaṃ smṛtam
pradhānaṃ sarvavidvānāṃ prāpyate hy amṛtaṃ tataḥ
tapobhir dustapais taptair vratais tais taiś ca puṣkaraiḥ |
ātmajñānaṃ vinā mokṣo na bhaved yogīnām api
ātmāyaṃ jñāyate tena tasya janma vidyate
śaṅkaro vā jineśo vā yo yasyābhimataḥ sa
eka eva prabhuḥ śānto nirvāṇastho vilokyate
paramātmā paraṃ jyotiḥ paraṃ brahma parāt paraḥ
achedyaś cāpy abhedyaś ca nirlepo nirmalaprabhuḥ
eko 'py anekarūpaś ca sthūlasūkṣmo laghur guruḥ |
brāhmaṇair lakṣyate brahmā viṣṇuḥ pītāṃ varais tathā |
rudras tapasvibhir dṛṣṭa eṣa eva nirañjanaḥ
jinendro jalpyate jainair buddhaḥ kṛtvā sa saugataiḥ |
kaulikaiḥ kola ākhyātaḥ sa evāyaṃ sanātanaḥ
sa tathā darśanaiḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ khyāta eko
bhāvabhedān na ma sthanti darśanāny ekavartmanā |
ekatrāpi sthitāḥ kārye pañcaite viṣayā yathā
niṣakalo nirmamaḥ śāntaḥ sarvajñaḥ sukhadaḥ prabhuḥ |
sa eva bhagavān eko devo jñeyo nirañjanaḥ
pūjayet taṃ tato yogī bhāvaṃ puṣpaiḥ sugandhibhiḥ
bhaktisthale viśāle ca vaśyaṃ kṛtvā sthiraṃ manaḥ |
uttārayet prabhoḥ puṇyam ārārtrikam iti kramāt
paramātmasvarūpaṃ taṃ svam ātmā cainaṃ vicintayet
saṃyamo niyamaś caiva karaṇaṃ ca tṛtīyakaṃ |
dhyānaṃ cetīha yogasya jñeyam aṣṭāṅgakaṃ budhaiḥ |
pūrṇāṅgakriyamāṇas tu muktaye syād asau satām

taddharmas tadvrataṃ
                        dhyānaṃ tat ta yo yoga eva saḥ | [tat tat ?]
sa eva hi padāroho na yatra kliśyate manaḥ
niyuñjita sadā cittaṃ sabhāve bhāvanāṃ kuru |
pade tatra gato yogī na punar janmatāṃ vrajet
jñeyaṃ sarvapadātītaṃ jñānaṃ ca mana ucyate |
jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ samaṃ kuryān nānyo mokṣapathaḥ punaḥ
bhruvopari mano nītvā tat paraṃ cāvalokyate |
parāt parataraṃ tac ca ta chukṣmaṃ tan nirañjanaṃ
parācinaṃ padaṃ jñeyaṃ yogibhis tan nirañjanaṃ
pavano mriyate yatra mano yatra vilīyate |
unmanībhāvam āyātaṃ labhate tat padaṃ kramāt
yadā yāty unmatibhāvaṃ tadā tat paramaṃ padaṃ
dhyātṛ dhyāno bhayābhāvo dhyeyanaikyaṃ padā vrajet |
athātaḥ procyate tattvaṃ durjñeyaṃ mahatām api
na brūte sno pi mūkas tu tena svapno na budhyate
phalaṃ ca yādṛśaṃ tasya śṛṇu saumya tadā darāt
avidyā rātri supte na citta mūkena yoginā |
kṛtas tena sthiro bhāva parabrahmaṇi yoginā |
sadā svapnārthaḥ kathitaḥ prājñaḥ yogayuktyā tavāgrataḥ
na kiṃ cic cintayec cittam unmanībhāvasaṅgataṃ |
smi kva gantāsmi kiṃ karomi smarāmi kiṃ |
iti yogī na jānāti laye līno nirañjane
aniruddhair indriyād vai dhyānād avyāvartate manaḥ
śamaṃ nīteṣu teṣv atra kaṣāyeṣv indriyeṣv api |
vaśyaṃ yena kṛtaṃ tasya bhaved vaśyaṃ jagatrayaṃ
yac chubhaṃ karmakatṛtvaṃ tat kuryān manasā saha |
manas tulyaṃ phalaṃ yasmāt śūnye śūnyaṃ bhavet punaḥ
kṛtvābhyāso yathā dhanvī lakṣyaṃ vidhyati tanmanā |
tasmād apy uttamaṃ sāraṃ pavitraṃ karmanāśanaṃ |
janma lakṣyair vratair ugrair yatraiva kṣīyate kva cit |
manaḥ śamarase magnaṃ tat karma kṣayayet kṣaṇāt
sā siddhiḥ syāt satāṃ yāno sarvatīrthāvagāhane
yogaṃ yogaṃ prakurvāṇā saṃbhrāmanti diśo diśo
saṃprāptā paramaṃ brahma sarve varṇā dvijātayaḥ
mokṣārthaṃ samatāṃ yāti samudraṃ sarito yathā
atītaṃ ca bhaviṣyac ca yan na śocati mānasaṃ |
gate śoko na yasyāstī na ca harṣaḥ samāgate |
yathā rātrau tame mūḍhā naiva paśyanti jantavaḥ ||
iti jñātvā budhair nityaṃ svātmane hitavāñchayā |
iti jñātvā budhair nityaṃ dūratas tyājyā na śrotavyā kadā cana
[avidyā nirmitā tyājyā na śrotavyā kadā cana ?]
rajas tamaś ca santyajya sattvam ekaṃ samāśrayet
santāṃ dhyānamaye saudhe sattvastambho dṛdho mataḥ
lakṣam ekaṃ kathaṃ tiṣṭhet tasmin karma rajo malaḥ
na laget padmini patre yathā toyaṃ svabhāvataḥ |
sphaṭiko malino na syāt rajasā chādito yathā |
na lipyate tathā pāpair ātmā saddhyānam āśritaḥ
rūpātītaṃ nirākāraṃ dhyānaṃ dhyeyaṃ tato niśaṃ
granthānn abhyasya tattvārthaṃ tattvajñāne punaḥ sudhīḥ |
palālam iva dhyānārthaṃ tyajed granthān śeṣataḥ
kṣīyante yāni kālena kiṃ taiḥ kartavyam akṣaraiḥ |
yāvan no nakṣaraprāptaṃ tāvan mokṣasukhaṃ kutaḥ
asminn eva bhave saumya vyomarūpaḥ sanātanaḥ |
layaṃ praṇavanādasya yas taṃ vetti sa yogavit
ghaṇṭānāde yathā prāpte praśāmyan madhuro bhavet |
yac cittaṃ sahajāvasthaṃ sa nādas tena bhidyate
tāvad eveṅdriyāṇi syuḥ kaṣāyās tāvad eva hi |
anāhate mano nāde yāval līnaṃ na yoginaḥ
tamaḥ sūryodayeneva tat sarvaṃ naśyati kṣaṇāt
sthūlaṃ sūkṣmaṃ ca sākāraṃ śubhadhyānam iti sphutaṃ |
śarīraṃ sakalaṃ tyaktvā brahmadvāre sthiraṃ manaḥ |
kriyate yadi tat sukṣmaṃ nirākāram ihocyate
tasmād apy ūrdhvagaṃ brahma dvādaśānte tathā smṛtaṃ
tyaktvā vā saṅgam anyaṃ paramapadasukhaprāptaye baddhabuddhiḥ |
kṛtvā cittaṃ sthiraṃ svaṃ śamarasakalitaṃ sattvaṃ ālambya bāḍhaṃ
dhyānaṃ dhyātuṃ yateta pratidinam amalaṃ śuddhadharmāvitaṇḍaḥ
chitvā saṃsṛtipāśam antarabalaṃ jitvātha mohādikaṃ dīkṣāṃ
mokṣakarīṃ prapadya sa budhaḥ pārśvaprabhor udyataḥ |
brahmajñānalayena kevalamayaṃ jñānaṃ samutpādya ca prāyan
śaucaṃ tapaś ca santoṣaḥ svādhyāyo devatāsmṛtiḥ |
niyamaḥ pañcadhā jñeyaḥ karaṇaṃ punar āsanaṃ
sthūle vā yadi vā sūkṣme sākāre ca nirākṛtau |
evaṃ yogo bhaved yogair aṣṭadhā saṃyamādibhiḥ |
divi bhūmau tathā kāśe bahir antaś ca yo vibhūḥ |
yo vibhāty eva bhāsātmā tasmai sarvātmane namaḥ
nāhaṃ baddho vimuktaś ca iti yasyāsti niścayaḥ |
